_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four speakers [an4.140:1.8]: A speaker who runs out of meaningful things to say, but not of ways of phrasing things.
A speaker who runs out of ways of phrasing things, but not of meaningful things to say.
A speaker who runs out of both meaningful things to say, and ways of phrasing things.
A speaker who never runs out of meaningful things to say, or ways of phrasing things.
